result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kari A. Knauf

records.addlTxt: Amended Bail/Bond
Amended bail bond faxed to Oneida County Jail for signature.
Spoke to L.S. at dispatch on 8/23/22 at 1:17PM to cancel warrant.

No contact with Antigo Walmart.

Amended

1:00 PM/Room 203. Defendant Kari A. Knauf appeared by phone, in custody in Oneida County Jail.  Attorney Cana G Kohn in court by Zoom for Kari A. Knauf.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly L Hays in court for the State of Wisconsin by Zoom. Court reviews status of case. State asks reason for Def.'s incarceration. Response by Attny Kohn, being held pending revocation. State requests $500 bond be kept in forfeiture status and $1,000 bond with same conditions. Attny Kohn asks that bail bond forfeiture hearing be removed and track along. State agreeable.  The Court orders $500 bond to be forfeited pending hearing, current bail bond forfeiture hearing to be removed and track along with case. Court orders warrant to be quashed. STC to be set. Court makes note on record. Nov. 28, 2022 at 11 a.m.  Court orders $1,000 signature bond with no contact with Antigo Walmart.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
(Off the record, Court confirms bond to be faxed to Oneida County Jail for signature.)
Return on warrant on August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 02:09 PM Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews history of case. Def. is eligible for P.D. Bond continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with Antigo Wal-Mart.

03:19 PM Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Def. is going to contact P.D. Victim rights complied. State gives bail/bond recommendation. Court order $1500 signature bond with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
